alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 05 at 10:52AM CDT until May 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa... Mississippi River at Dubuque LD11 affecting Jo Daviess and Dubuque Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Illinois...Iowa...Missouri... Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19 affecting Hancock, Lee and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Gregory Landing affecting Hancock and Clark Counties. Mississippi River at Keithsburg affecting Mercer, Des Moines, Louisa and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at New Boston LD17 affecting Mercer and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Muscatine affecting Mercer, Muscatine, Rock Island and Louisa Counties. Mississippi River at Ill. City LD16 affecting Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Rock Island LD15 affecting Scott, Muscatine and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Le Claire LD14 affecting Scott and Rock Island Counties. Mississippi River at Fulton LD13 affecting Carroll, Clinton and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Bellevue LD12 affecting Jackson, Carroll, Clinton and Jo Daviess Counties. Mississippi River at Camanche affecting Scott, Clinton, Rock Island and Whiteside Counties. Mississippi River at Gladstone LD18 affecting Des Moines and Henderson Counties. Mississippi River at Dubuque affecting Jackson, Dubuque and Jo Daviess Counties. .Heavy rain will fall on a deep primed snowpack leading to the melt increasing. Flows in rivers will increase quickly and reach critical levels. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Mississippi River at Keokuk LD19. * WHEN...Until early Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.4 feet, U.S. Highway 61 closes at the bridge over the Des Moines River between Alexandria and Keokuk. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:10 AM CDT Friday the stage was 17.7 feet. - Recent Activity - The river is currently cresting. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage Wednesday morning and continue falling to 14.8 feet next Friday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued this afternoon.
